attributes.action: urgently review and overturn the Ministry of Defence decision to reject the request for financial aid by survivors of the D-Day landings which would enable them to attend the 65th anniversary celebrations in Normandy.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We strongly petition that this shameful decision does not reflect the wishes of the citizens of this country that these last few survivors are able to travel to Normanday to take their rightful place amongst others from around the world who will gather to mark this momentous date and remember the fallen on both sides.   

We also petition that Britain's part in the landings is recognised by representatives from government and Royalty attending the official commemoration on our behalf.

Lastly, but by no means least, we further petion that the debt that is owed to the survivors and the fallen of the D-Day landings is shown its right and proper respect on our behalf.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
